title: Help tracking down [my system's] bug in building spack's htop
body:
I use spack to build htop on one of my CentOS 7 systems and it works Just Fine(tm).

I'm moving onto a fancier, newer CentOS 7 system and I noticed that the spack built htop doesn't have any text in the bottom half.  It doesn't seem to be a color scheme issue (e.g. background == foreground).

I noticed that it's linking against the system ncurses library:

```
[hartzelg@lb093login spack]$ ldd opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/htop-2.0.2-khg4zvn6noskhbmhsbysa5bmyo24u2nf/bin/htop
	linux-vdso.so.1 =>  (0x00002aaaaaaab000)
	libncursesw.so.5 => /lib64/libncursesw.so.5 (0x00002aaaaaabf000)
	libtinfo.so.5 => /lib64/libtinfo.so.5 (0x00002aaaaacf7000)
	libm.so.6 => /lib64/libm.so.6 (0x00002aaaaaf21000)
	libc.so.6 => /lib64/libc.so.6 (0x00002aaaab224000)
	libdl.so.2 => /lib64/libdl.so.2 (0x00002aaaab5e6000)
	/lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x0000555555554000)
```

which is weird because a) the package says it depends on ncurses and b) my less-new CentOS 7 system links against the spack ncurses like it should.

I ran `spack configure htop` and was trawling through the `config.log` file and noticed that when configure is probing for ncurses and looking at the spack copy it fails.

Here is [a gist of the relevant part of the config.log](https://gist.github.com/hartzell/35c9ddacaf6e1944799ab9f984c35ed4).

I'm [temporarily] out of ideas and am hoping that someone in Spack-land might be able to take a swing with the clue-bat.

Any ideas?

**Thanks!**
